DOC.brief_title: Survivorship Care Plan Promoting Physical Activity Breast Colorectal Cancer Survivors Wisconsin
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Establish feasibility enrol breast colorectal cancer survivor along co-survivor randomized physical activity promotion trial . II . Determine short-term effect enhance survivorship care plan ( SCP ) compare standard SCP objectively-measured physical activity among survivor co-survivors . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I ( Enhanced SCP ) : Participants receive enhance SCP , comprise personalize document summarize treatment follow recommendation , include basic physical activity guidance . Participants also receive copy United States Department Agriculture ( USDA ) Dietary Guidelines Americans , well standardize email wellness tip information stress management provide American Heart Association 's website `` Healthy Habits '' 1 , 2 , 4 , 8 week . Specific topic email include `` positive self-talk '' , `` daily relaxation breathe technique '' , `` good sleep '' , `` way find pleasure '' . Participants also wear Fitbit web-integrated physical activity tracker daily 12 week receive email feedback specific participant base series factor , include Fitbit data , Emails may provide encouragement , `` keep good work '' , and/or specific instruction regard compliance intervention , goal meet physical activity goal , potential strategy increase/maintain level physical activity , etc. , technical how-to support include use device website , question goal-setting . ARM II ( Control ) : Participants receive standard SCP , comprise personalize document summarize treatment follow recommendation , include basic physical activity guidance . Participants also receive copy USDA Dietary Guidelines Americans , well standardize email wellness tip information stress management provide American Heart Association 's website `` Healthy Habits '' 1 , 2 , 4 , 8 week . Specific topic email include `` positive self-talk '' , `` daily relaxation breathe technique '' , `` good sleep '' , `` way find pleasure '' .
DOC.criteria: CRITERIA FOR SURVIVORS : Have diagnosis stage IIII female breast cancer colorectal cancer within past 5 year ; bilateral multiple primary breast cancer permit ; individual one type cancer ( e.g. , breast melanoma ) permit long breast ( colorectal ) diagnosis meet criteria primary treatment cancer ongoing Have complete primary treatment cancer ; primary treatment define complete ( ) definitive cancer surgery , ( b ) ( neo ) adjuvant chemotherapy , and/or ( c ) ( neo ) adjuvant radiation ; breast cancer patient still receive adjuvant endocrine human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 ( HER2 ) target therapy eligible , would colon cancer patient receive targeted agent ; question whether patient meet eligibility requirement , Dr. Tevaarwerk ( coI , Oncology ) adjudicate Are willing attempt increase physical activity level Have cosurvivor ( friend family member ) willing participate research study ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR BOTH SURVIVORS AND COSURVIVORS : Have highspeed access internet home work ; This could broadband , digital subscriber line ( DSL ) , and/or access smartphone tablet via wireless provider Fluent English Willing able attend study visit University Wisconsin ( UW ) Madison Cosurvivors must age 18 year EXCLUSION CRITERIA SPECIFIC TO SURVIVORS : Survivors must evidence recurrent metastatic disease Survivors must previously receive SCP unwilling receive one Survivors must perform > = 60 minute ( min ) /week moderatevigorous physical activity EXCLUSION CRITERIA FOR BOTH SURVIVORS AND COSURVIVORS : Conditions would interfere safety moderatetovigorous intensity physical activity ; participant screen safety use validated Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire ( PARQ ) Any physical mental health condition would interfere full participation study , include individual unable read consent material appear lack capacity consent Any individual consider `` vulnerable group '' , include pregnant woman prisoner
